action.action-desc: Mr. Cuellar introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To provide for the expansion of the Starr-Camargo Bridge near Rio Grande City, Texas, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Starr–Camargo Bridge Expansion Act.

subsection.text: The first section of Public Law 87–532 (76 Stat. 153; 130 Stat. 411) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting and expand after construct;
by inserting , including the expansion and addition of adjacent spans to the existing international bridge, after thereto;
by striking to maintain and inserting and to maintain, control,; and
by striking such bridge and inserting those bridges; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting expansion, after construction,.

subsection.header: Rights of Starr–Camargo Bridge Company and successors and assigns
subsection.text: Section 3(a) of Public Law 87–532 (76 Stat. 153; 130 Stat. 411) is amended by inserting , as needed for the location, construction, expansion, control, operation, and maintenance of the bridges referred to in subsection (a)(2) at or near Rio Grande City, Texas after chapter 466).
Section 5 of Public Law 87–532 (76 Stat. 153; 130 Stat. 411) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting by the Starr–Camargo Bridge Company and its successors and assigns after constructed;
by striking five and inserting 65; and
by striking date of enactment of this Act and inserting date of enactment of the Starr–Camargo Bridge Expansion Act.

subsection.text: Nothing in this section or the amendments made by this section—

paragraph.text: grants new rights or duties to the San Benito International Bridge Company (known as the Free Trade International Bridge as of the date of enactment of this Act); or

alters, repeals, or voids any rights or duties held by the San Benito International Bridge Company (known as the Free Trade International Bridge as of the date of enactment of this Act) under Public Law 87–532 (76 Stat. 153; 130 Stat. 411), as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of this Act.
